Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.

Sincerely,
Dayna Lamkey, MA, LLPC

Allegation Allegation #1
In November of 2024 Youth A and Staff 1 were having an

Investigation Allegation #1
Complainant was contacted via phone on 2/28/2025.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Youth A was interviewed at a child advocacy center on 4/9/2025.
Youth A reported she is dating Staff 1 and that he is 20 years old.
Youth A reported she did not start dating Staff 1 until 3 weeks
after he stopped working at the facility. Youth A reported she is in
the relationship with Staff 1 by choice and Staff 1 has never forced
her to do anything. Youth A declined to participate further in the
interview stating that she would not get Staff 1 in trouble.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 4/16/2025 along with the MDHHS
Specialist. Staff 1 reported he met Youth A when working at the
facility and would see her there when working approximately 3
days out of the week. Staff 1 reported when she was placed at the
facility, he did not have any inappropriate contact with her or give
her rides during that time. Staff 1 reported he gave her rides on
two occasions when she was moved to independent living. Staff 1
reported one time he gave her a ride to and from the store and the
other time he took her to and from the movies. Staff 1 reported
they are in a relationship now and that they did not start dating or
having any sexual contact until after he was terminated from the
facility. Staff 1 denied having any inappropriate contact with any
youth at the facility while he was employed there. Staff 1 reported
he was terminated from Vista Maria for giving Youth A rides
because he was not supposed to have contact with youth at the
facility outside his role of employment.
2

Human Resources Manager was interviewed along with MDHHS
Specialist on 4/16/2025. Human Resources Manager reported
there was suspicion of a face time call between Staff 1 and Youth
A. Human Resource Manager reported an Education Specialist
who is no longer working for the facility reported to Human
Resources that when the walked past Youth A, Youth A was on a
face time call and it appeared to be with Staff 1 who got out of the
view of camera upon seeing someone walk past. Human
Resources Manager reported Youth A and Staff 1 were both
questioned about the incident, and both denied having any phone
contact. Human Resources Manager reported Youth A denied
having Staff 1’s phone number. Human Resources Manager
reported Staff 1 reported he was on vacation at the time and was
not in the country at the time of the call. Human Resources
Manager reported on 11/30/25, a note from Gate Security Guard
was given to Human Resources stating Staff 1 came to the facility
gate in a car that was not his own and did not use his badge
however the gate staff recognized him. Human Resources
Manager reported from the gate notes and video footage, the car
circles around the gate and waits until Youth A comes out and
gets into the car. Human Resources Manager reported it was
believed by the Gate Security Guard Staff 1 and Youth A kissed
before driving away. Human Resources Manager reported they
reviewed the footage and security note and terminated Staff 1’s
employment on 12/4/2024. Human Resources Manager reported
Staff 1 denied to them that it was him in the video during their
conversation. Human Resources Manager reported as Youth A is
in independent living, she is allowed to leave the facility and that a
complaint was not called into child protective services because at
the time there was not reasonable suspicion of abuse or neglect.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the
MDHHS Specialist on 4/16/25. Staff 2 reported she recalled Youth
A, however, did not have a lot of contact with her and did not have
knowledge of any rumors or incidents with any youth and Staff 1.
Staff 2 denied witnessing any incidents or inappropriate interaction
between Youth A and Staff 1 other than she observed them
talking one time to one another and Youth A was in a sports bra at
the time. She heard someone instruct Youth A to put a shirt on.
Staff 2 denied seeing them touch or hearing what they said to one
another. Staff 2 stated she has always seen other staff nearby
since male staff cannot be alone with the girls just for safety
reasons. Staff 2 reported she heard rumors that Staff 1 was
texting with Youth A but was not sure where the rumors came
from or if they were true.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the
MDHHS Specialist on 4/16/25. Staff 3 reported she could tell that
3

Youth A cared about Staff 1 and liked being around him as
evidenced by her trying to be around him when he was working in
the area. Staff 3 denied ever witnessing Staff 1 be inappropriate
verbally or physically with Youth A or any other youth.
Team Leader was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along
with MDHHS Specialist on 4/16/25. Team Leader reported he saw
Staff 1 interact with Youth A and never witnessed anything
inappropriate including any physical touching or sexual language
or flirtation. Team Leader reported he heard rumors that there
may be something inappropriate going on between them including
texting and flirting. Team Leader reported he approached Staff 1
and advised that he heard things and Staff 1 needed to watch
himself. Team Leader reported that it was reported to him that
Youth A was sending photos to Staff 1. Team Leader was not able
to recall which staff made the reports to him. Team Leader
reported Youth A denied doing so and denied having Staff 1’s
phone number. Team Leader reported a phone number was found
written in Youth A's room and they called it and it was Staff 1.
Team Leader reported he reported the concern to Human
Resources. Team Leader reported there was also a concern he
heard about in which a staff was walking past and saw Youth A on
a face time call and the staff thought it was Staff 1 she was on the
face time call with but when she approached the person on the
call moved the camera off of them. Team Leader did not have
further information regarding this concern. Team Leader reported
it was known that some youth at the facility liked Staff 1 and would
attempt to be flirtatious with him and therefore he would remind
Staff 1 to have professional boundaries. Team Leader reported he
never witnessed Staff 1 be inappropriate with any youth including
Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/16/25. Supervisor reported he was Staff
1’s supervisor and worked with him an average of five days per
week. Supervisor denied knowledge or witnessing Staff 1 doing
anything inappropriate with or around Youth A or any other youth.
Supervisor reported Staff 1 was professional and positive around
the youth in the facility and he did his job. Supervisor denied
knowledge of the concerns until he was notified of the termination
of Staff 1.

reported Staff 1 and Youth A were secretly dating each other and

Education Specialist interview was attempted on 5/15/25 via the
last known phone number from the facility. The phone number is
no longer in service.
Gate Security Guard was interviewed via phone on 5/19/25. Gate
Security Guard reported he observed Staff 1 pull into the entrance
of the facility and parked at which time Gate Security Guard
approached the vehicle and asked him to park out of the way.
Gate Security Guard reported he recognized Staff 1 immediately
and inquired why he was not at work at which time Staff 1
informed him he was picking up at youth. Gate Security Guard
reported Staff 1 moved the car and awaited the youth to come out
and leave. Gate Security Guard reported he felt inclined to report
the incident to his supervisor after it occurred when he heard from
a coworker that there was a rumor of a staff being inappropriate
with a youth. Gate Security Guard stated he reported the incident
to his supervisor who instructed him to write an incident report.
When asked if there was any standard or policy with gate
personnel on allowing staff to retrieve youth when they are not
working, Gate Security Guard stated he was not aware of any.

Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the

Youth B participated in a forensic interview at a child advocacy

Documentation Reviewed:
• Employment Termination Letter regarding Staff 1 dated
12/4/24. Letter cites the reason for termination to be failure
to comply with the Employment Behavior Policy, POL-022-
114 as evidenced by security gate footage in which Staff 1
was confirmed to be coming to the facility to pick up Youth
A.
7

• Employment Behavior Policy, POL-022-114 that failure to
maintain professional interpersonal relationships with
clients is prohibited.
• Staff and Client Interaction Policy states that transporting
current or former clients need prior authorization. Policy
also states that presenting oneself in a flirtatious or sexual
manner to clients is prohibited.
• Photo stills were reviewed to show a man in a brightly
colored coat in the driver’s seat of a black Cadillac.
• Security gate note authored by Gate Security Guard states
at approximately 12:00pm on 11/30/2024 a black Cadillac
enters the driveway and parks in the exit lane rather than
pulling to the entrance lanes to enter the facility lot. The
note goes on to report Gate Security Guard approaches the
vehicle and recognizes the driver to be Staff 1 and directs
him to move the vehicle. Note states Staff 1 informed Gate
Security Guard the intention to pick up a youth. Note states
Youth A walked out to the vehicle and left with Staff 1,
returning at approximately 3:14pm.
Analysis Allegation #1:
A rule violation is established regarding this allegation.
Suspicions were reported to be circulating in the facility that Staff
1 was in an inappropriate relationship with Youth A during Staff 1’s
employment. Interviews with staff and documentation from
Human Resources show that the facility explored possible
concerns regarding contact between Youth A and Staff 1.
Documentation shows Staff 1 was terminated upon receipt of
footage from the security gate of him pulling into the facility
entrance to retrieve Youth A. Although Youth A and Staff 1 denied
their relationship beginning prior to Staff 1’s termination of
employment, both parties reported being in a romantic relationship
at the time of their interviews. Staff 1 reported picking up Youth A
while not working and not for work functions while he was still
employed at the facility.
Allegation #2:
There are no rule violations established regarding this allegation.
Youth B reported the allegation in which she and Staff 1 engaged
in sexual contact was made up. There was one youth interview
that alleged witnessing that something may have occurred
however this youth reported not knowing what Staff 1 and Youth B
were doing in the sensory room. Further, remaining youth and
staff interviews regarding this allegation denied any witnessing of
inappropriate contact between Youth B and Staff 1. There were no
reports in interviews with staff or youth that Youth B was with Staff
1 or that Staff 1 was involved in Youth B’s AWOL from the facility.
8

Youth B and Staff 1 both denied having contact with one another
since Staff 1’s termination.
CONSULTATION:
Consultation is being provided to the facility regarding policy and
procedure surrounding staff retrieving youth outside of work
functions. It is recommended the facility implement a procedure
for reporting suspicious behavior of staff related to their arrivals
and departures of the facility. This procedure should clarify
behaviors that would not be appropriate for a staff including
retrieving youth after their working hours and a process for
confirming approved transports.
Conclusion Repeat violation established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
